name: CLOSE UP TWIN OTTER ACTION! British Antarctic Survey at Calgary/Springbank Airport
description:
Calgary/Springbank Airport is Calgary's secondary airport, and mainly deals with flight training traffic. However, it's also home to a Twin Otter maintenance facility, meaning we sometimes see these special birds from the British Antarctic Survey, among other operators.

Earlier this week, VP-FAZ flew up to Calgary after spending the summer in Antarctica, and will likely stay here until the fall for maintenance. Always nice to see a larger aircraft among the Cessnas, and on Springbank's least-used runway to boot!

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Operator: British Antarctic Survey
Aircraft: De Havilland Canada DHC-6-300 Twin Otter
Livery: British Antarctic Survey Red
Engines: 2x PT6A-34
Registration: VP-FAZ
Route: Casper (CPR) - Calgary (YYC) - Calgary/Springbank (YBW)
Callsign: Victor Papa Foxtrot Alpha Zulu
Runway used: 08
Date filmed: March 16 2021
